summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting assistance in arranging a legal call for Ghislaine Maxwell with her attorneys to discuss a time-sensitive court filing matter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email; her attorneys are trying to arrange a legal call with her regarding a time-sensitive court filing.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Author of the email requesting assistance to arrange a legal call for Ghislaine Maxwell with her defense attorneys.

connections.description: Prosecutor corresponding about logistical arrangements for the defendant's legal communications.

events.title: Request for Legal Call Arrangement
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails to request assistance in arranging a legal call between Ghislaine Maxwell and her attorneys to discuss a time-sensitive court filing.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email is dated July 7, 2020, during Ghislaine Maxwell's pre-trial detention.
Maxwell's defense attorneys were having difficulty arranging a legal call with her to discuss a time-sensitive court filing.
The prosecutor (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York is facilitating communication logistics for the defense.
The correspondence indicates ongoing legal proceedings and coordination between prosecution and defense teams.
